register.description:
Raw status of sources. Raw status is set even if the interrupt is not enabled; Write 1 to set the raw status (mostly for debug)
The following is the behavior for read/write into each of the individual fields : Write 0: No action Write 1: Set event (for debug) Read 0: No event pending Read 1: Event pending

bitfield.description: MC FE end of slice interrupt raw status
Watch-point for L3 port #1 interrupt raw status
MC-DMA OCP L3 master port (#0) received Sresp=ERR from platform interrupt raw status
MC-DMA OCP L3 master port (#1) received Sresp=ERR from platform interrupt raw status
Unexpected response received from L3 master port #1 interrupt raw status
MC FE end of MB interrupt raw status
MC Back-end end of MB interrupt raw status
MC FE end of row interrupt raw status
MC-DMA OCP L3 master port (#1) send command for zero byte transfer interrupt raw status
Unexpected response received from L3 master port #0 interrupt raw status
Watch-point for L3 port #0 interrupt raw status
MC-DMA OCP L3 master port (#0) send command for zero byte transfer interrupt raw status

register.description:
Status of enabled sources. The individual status bits are not set, unless the source is enabled (by setting corresponding bit in IRQ_ENABLE_SET register) Write "1" to specific bit in this register to clear the status after interrupt has been serviced. Note : Writing "1" clears the "raw" status as well Note : Writing "1" generates internal EOI. The interrupt line is pulsed again, if any of the interrupt sources are still active (any of the status bits are "1") after the write of "1".
The following is the behavior for read/write into each of the individual fields : Write 0: No action Write 1: Clear (raw) event - clears the corresponding bit in this register as well as the "raw" status bit in the IRQ_STATUS_RAW register Read 0: No enabled event pending Read 1: Event pending

bitfield.description: MC FE end of slice interrupt status
Watch-point for L3 port #1 interrupt status
MC-DMA OCP L3 master port (#0) received Sresp=ERR from platform interrupt status
MC-DMA OCP L3 master port (#1) received Sresp=ERR from platform interrupt status
Unexpected response received from L3 master port #1 interrupt status
MC FE end of MB interrupt status
MC Back-end end of MB interrupt status
MC FE end of row interrupt status
MC-DMA OCP L3 master port (#1) send command for zero byte transfer interrupt status
Unexpected response received from L3 master port #0 interrupt status
Watch-point for L3 port #0 interrupt status
MC-DMA OCP L3 master port (#0) send command for zero byte transfer interrupt status

register.description:
Interrupt enable for each of the sources. Writing "1" to specific field in this register enables the corresponding source for interrupt generatation The read value reflects whether the corresponding source is enabled/disabled for interrupt generation
The following is the behavior for read/write into each of the individual fields : Write 0: No action Write 1: Enable interrupt Read 0: Interrupt disabled (masked) Read 1: Interrupt enabled

bitfield.description: MC FE end of slice interrupt enable set
Watch-point for L3 port #1 interrupt enable set
MC-DMA OCP L3 master port (#0) received Sresp=ERR from platform interrupt enable set
MC-DMA OCP L3 master port (#1) received Sresp=ERR from platform interrupt enable set
Unexpected response received from L3 master port #1 interrupt enable set
MC FE end of MB interrupt enable set
MC Back-end end of MB interrupt enable set
MC FE end of row interrupt enable set
MC-DMA OCP L3 master port (#1) send command for zero byte transfer interrupt enable set
Unexpected response received from L3 master port #0 interrupt enable set
Watch-point for L3 port #0 interrupt enable set
MC-DMA OCP L3 master port (#0) send command for zero byte transfer interrupt enable set

register.description:
Interrupt disable for each of the sources. Writing "1" to specific field in this register disables the corresponding source for interrupt generatation The read value reflects whether the corresponding source is enabled/disabled for interrupt generation
The following is the behavior for read/write into each of the individual fields : Write 0: No action Write 1: Disable interrupt Read 0: Interrupt disabled (masked) Read 1: Interrupt enabled

bitfield.description: MC FE end of slice interrupt enable clear
Watch-point for L3 port #1 interrupt enable clear
MC-DMA OCP L3 master port (#0) received Sresp=ERR from platform interrupt enable clear
MC-DMA OCP L3 master port (#1) received Sresp=ERR from platform interrupt enable clear
Unexpected response received from L3 master port #1 interrupt enable clear
MC FE end of MB interrupt enable clear
MC Back-end end of MB interrupt enable clear
MC FE end of row interrupt enable clear
MC-DMA OCP L3 master port (#1) send command for zero byte transfer interrupt enable clear
Unexpected response received from L3 master port #0 interrupt enable clear
Watch-point for L3 port #0 interrupt enable clear
MC-DMA OCP L3 master port (#0) send command for zero byte transfer interrupt enable clear

register.description:
Interrupt blocking configuration for each of the sources.
If a bit in this register is set to "1", MC5 halts after it generates an interrupt for the corresponding interrupt source, and waits for interrupt acknowledgement for that interrupt line before continuing execution.
If a bit in this register is set to "0", MC5 does not halt after it generates an interrupt for the corresponding interrupt source.
The configuration in this register only apply to enabled interrupt sources.

bitfield.description: MC FE end of slice interrupt blocking enabled
Watch-point for L3 port #1 interrupt blocking enabled
MC-DMA OCP L3 master port (#0) received Sresp=ERR from platform interrupt blocking enabled
MC-DMA OCP L3 master port (#1) received Sresp=ERR from platform interrupt blocking enabled
Unexpected response received from L3 master port #1 interrupt blocking enabled
MC FE end of MB interrupt blocking enabled
MC Back-end end of MB interrupt blocking enabled
MC FE end of row interrupt blocking enabled
MC-DMA OCP L3 master port (#1) send command for zero byte transfer interrupt blocking enabled
Unexpected response received from L3 master port #0 interrupt blocking enabled
Watch-point for L3 port #0 interrupt blocking enabled
MC-DMA OCP L3 master port (#0) send command for zero byte transfer interrupt blocking enabled

register.description: Watchpoint interrupt is raised when the DMA address on any L3 port is more than this bound.

bitfield.description: Lower 32 bits of the address bound.

register.description: L3 Port#1 Address which cause watch-point interrupt for L3 Port#1 (WATCHPOINT_L3_1)

bitfield.description: Lower 32 bits of the address bound.

Enable for SKIP_BC; 1=>Enabled (BC Ready is required for thread to proceed); 0=>Disabled
Enable for GW_REFWINDOW_BC; 1=>Enabled (BC Ready is required for thread to proceed); 0=>Disabled
Enable for Spare BC #0; 1=>Enabled (BC Ready is required for thread to proceed); 0=>Disabled

register.description: Enable and SL2 location of the Auto Load MMR Image

bitfield.description: Program Auto Load SL2 Base Address
1 => Program Auto Load Enabled

register.description: Enable and SL2 location of the Context MMR Image

bitfield.description: 1 => Cotext Auto Load Enabled
Context Auto Load / Store SL2 Base Address
1 => Cotext Auto Store Enabled

BC Clear for Growing Window Reference Pixel SL2BC
BC Clear for SliceInfo SL2BC

BC idle for SliceInfo SL2BC

register.description: Debug Capability register is used by debug software to determine which optional debug modules are present and how many instances of each module exist.

bitfield.description: Indicates if the HWA supports an module ownership. v2.0 and above. b0 - Not Supported. b1 - Ownership supported.
The number of counter modules that exist. The registers supporting the counter modules must be implemented consecutively in the memory map.
Whether HWA Core Execution status and control is supported. b0 - Not Supported. b1 - Supported.
b0 - Trigger Outputs are not supported. b1 - Trigger Outputs are supported.
Indicates if the WP resources has corresponding data qualification. b0 - Not supported. b1 - Data qualifiers are supported.
The number of watchpoint modules that exist. The registers supporting the watchpoint modules must be implemented consecutively in the memory map
Number of Trigger Channels Supported. b00 ------ No channels supported. b01 ------ One channel supported. b10 ------ Two channels supported. Others ---- Reserved.
Whether HWA Core reset is supported or not which does not affect debug logic. b0 - Not Supported. b1 - Supported.
Indicates if the HWA supports an indirect memory access port. v2.0 and above. b0 - Not Supported. b1 - Indirect port supported.
The number of breakpoint modules that exist. The registers supporting the breakpoint modules must be implemented consecutively in the memory map.
b0 - Trigger Inputs are not supported. b1 - Trigger Inputs are supported.
Whether HWA Core supports SWBP or not. b0 - Not Supported. b1 - Supported.

register.description: Debug Control register is used by debug software to control all of the basic debug functions.

bitfield.description: Debug Restart Status bit. This bit is normally set when the DBG_HALT bit transitions from 1 to 0 when the natural execution state is entered. It is a sticky bit. It may also be set when a synchronous run causes the accelerator to leave halted state. Reading 1 means HWA Core exited halted state (at least temporarily). Reading 0 means HWA Core did not exit halted state. Writing 1 shall clear the bit if set. There is no restriction on when it can be cleared. Writing 0 shall have no effect.

Global debug run control. The bit will be read as being set upon entry to HALTED state due to halted state being entered because of SWBP, HWBP, HWWP, EMU0 / 1 trigger or manual halt requested through this control. Writing 1 when read 0 shall cause a halt on the next possible halt boundary. Writing 0 when read 1 returns the system to the natural execution state. A synchronous run hardware request has the same effect. Reading 1 means that the halted state has been reached or been requested by the manual halt mechanism. Reading 0 means that the target is in its natural execution state. NOTE: 1. The natural execution state means the FSM state entered prior to last entry into Halted state. 2. This would be the last application requested FSM state unless the DBG_SYS_EXE_REQ control was used to change it.
Execution halted due to single step completion. Set to 1 when the single step completes. Set to 0 when execution resumes.
Statues of EMU0 input. This bit indicates the current value of the EMU0 input.
Execution halted due to trigger in on EMU0 input. Set to 1 when halt due to EMU0 input completes. Set to 0 when execution resumes.
Execution halted due to an application update of the DBG_HALT bit. Set to 1 when halt due to DBG_HALT update completes. Set to 0 when execution resumes.

Single Step Execution enable. When this bit is set, the accelerator core shall be halted upon execution of a single instruction. This is after the accelerator core has left the halted state by clearing the DBG_HALT control bit. Writing 1 enables halting when the next instruction following exit from halted state is executed. Writing 0 disables halts via single step. NOTE: 1. When the accelerator core enters its natural execution state, it may or may not execute an instruction and re-enter HALTED state.

EMU0 output control. The cross trigger output control. This values in this field determine the behavior of the outputs generated on EMU0. NOTE: The effect of setting 1 is ignored if the HWA Core is currently in HALTED state until the HWA core exits and re-enters HALTED state. DBG_EMUn_CNTL=0, Output Enable=De-asserted, Output=0, Pulse=NA, Description=No output. Input only. DBG_EMUn_CNTL=1, Output Enable=Stopping , Output=0, Pulse=Yes, Description=Pulse on halt. If this bit is set when halted then no effect until the HWA re-enters halted state. DBG_EMUn_CNTL=2, Output Enable=HWBP, Output=0, Pulse=Yes, Description=Pulse when any HWBP triggers. DBG_EMUn_CNTL=3, Output Enable=HWWP, Output=0, Pulse=Yes, Description=Pulse when any HWWP triggers. DBG_EMUn_CNTL=4, Output Enable=Asserted, Output=1, Pulse=No, Description=Drive pin high. DBG_EMUn_CNTL=5, Output Enable=Asserted, Output=0, Pulse=No, Description=Drive pin low. DBG_EMUn_CNTL=6 to 15, Description=Reserved.
Execution halted due to trigger from HWBP or WP. Set to 1 halt due to breakpoint or watchpoint completes. Set to 0 when execution resumes.

This bit enables the halts on watchpoint or hardware breakpoint trigger events. Writing 1 enables halting on any hardware breakpoint or watchpoint trigger. Each breakpoint or watchpoint resource also has a local enable. Writing 0 disables halts via hardware breakpoints or watchpoints.
The execution status of the module. Set to 1 when halted due to debug event. Set to 0 when execution resumes.
EMU0 input trigger enable. Writing 1 enables halting on the falling edge of the EMU0 input. Writing 0 disables halts via EMU0 input.

register.description: Hardware Brakepoint Control for MC FE (at MB-Index)

bitfield.description: This bit configures the module to generate halt when triggered. Writing 1 enables a HWA halt when triggered. The DBG_CNTL:DBG_HALT_BPWP must also be set for the halt to occur. Writing 0 disables halt upon trigger.
This is the local enable for the hardware breakpoint module. Writing 1 to this bit enables the module to generate an instruction address match trigger. Writing 0 to this bit disables the module.
This bit is Set to "1" when HWBP located at the MB_Index in DBG_HWBP_n_MB_Index is executed. Set to 1 when executing the MB index = DBG_HWBP_n_MB_Index. Cleared to 0 by writing 1 to this bit.

register.description: Hardware Brakepoint from MC FE: At MB-Index

bitfield.description: Column index of the MB. After processing that MB HWA will halt.
Row index of the MB. After processing that MB HWA will halt.
Mask for the column index of DBG_HWBP_n_MB_INDEX
Mask for the row index of DBG_HWBP_n_MB_INDEX

register.description: Hardware Brakepoint Control for MC BE (at MB-Index)

bitfield.description: This bit configures the module to generate halt when triggered. Writing 1 enables a HWA halt when triggered. The DBG_CNTL:DBG_HALT_BPWP must also be set for the halt to occur. Writing 0 disables halt upon trigger.
This is the local enable for the hardware breakpoint module. Writing 1 to this bit enables the module to generate an instruction address match trigger. Writing 0 to this bit disables the module.
This bit is Set to "1" when HWBP located at the MB_Index in DBG_HWBP_n_MB_Index is executed. Set to 1 when executing the MB index = DBG_HWBP_n_MB_Index. Cleared to 0 by writing 1 to this bit.

register.description: Hardware Brakepoint from MC BE: At MB-Index

bitfield.description: Column index of the MB. After processing that MB HWA will halt.
Row index of the MB. After processing that MB HWA will halt.
Mask for the column index of DBG_HWBP_n_MB_INDEX
Mask for the row index of DBG_HWBP_n_MB_INDEX
DMA Operates using only 1 L3 port
Writing 1 will clear the horizontal cache; doesn't impact vertical cache; this register should be written when MC5 is in a halted state else output will be corrupted.

register.description: MMR Register to Enable L3 Data Fetch Statistics

bitfield.description: 1=> L3_PORT_0_DATA_FETCH Counter is enabled 0=> disabled
1=> L3_PORT_1_DATA_FETCH Counter is enabled 0=> disabled

register.description: MMR Register to Clear L3 Data Fetch Statistics

bitfield.description: Write 1 to Clear L3_PORT_0_DATA_FETCH
Write 1 to Clear L3_PORT_1_DATA_FETCH

register.description: Amount of Data Fetch in Bytes from MC-DMA L3 Port 0

bitfield.description: Amount of Data Fetch in Bytes from MC-DMA L3 Port 0

register.description: Amount of Data Fetch in Bytes from MC-DMA L3 Port 1

bitfield.description: Amount of Data Fetch in Bytes from MC-DMA L3 Port 1
